metadata.label: 資料解説
metadata.value: 『第1回江戸資料展』図録解説p.25「今も行なわれている子供の祝い｡男女3歳を髪置（かみお）き、男子5歳を袴着（はかまぎ）、女子7歳を帯解（おびとき）といった。着飾った子供をつれて各所の神社に詣でるが、とりわけ神田明神はにぎわった｡(Illustration of people celebrating their children turning seven

metadata.label: 資料解説
metadata.value: five and three years old)This is an illustration of a celebration

metadata.label: 資料解説
metadata.value: which continues to this day. During this celebration

metadata.label: 資料解説
metadata.value: boys and girls do up their hair when they turn three

metadata.label: 資料解説
metadata.value: boys wear a "hakama (traditional formal attire)" when they turn five

metadata.label: 資料解説
metadata.value: and girls put on an "obi (sash)" when they turn seven. Children were dressed up and taken to shrines in various places

metadata.label: 資料解説
metadata.value: but Kanda My?jin Shrine was particularly popular.」
